paper.title: Rule-based requirements specification and validation
paper.venue: Conference on Advanced Information Systems Engineering
paper.abstract: Requirements specification has only recently been acknowledged as one of the most important phases in the overall software life cycle. Since the statement of a complete and consistent set of requirements involves user participation, our approach investigates how user oriented formalisms and techniques could be employed for the specification and capturing of requirements. We propose the use of rules as a natural means for expressing the application domain knowledge, and introduce a number of techniques such as semantic prototyping and animation for the validation of the requirements.
